meanings.definition: A person who is in agreement or support of a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: She is a loyal sider of the team, always cheering them on.
meanings.sent2: The political candidate gained many siders during the campaign.
meanings.sent3: The group's biggest sider brought homemade banners to every game.
meanings.sent4: He was a dedicated sider, standing by his friend through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The sider's unwavering support was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: A celestial body that is visible in the night sky.
meanings.sent1: The moon is a well-known sider that lights up the night.
meanings.sent2: Stargazers often use telescopes to observe different siders.
meanings.sent3: The shooting star raced across the sky, surprising the siders below.
meanings.sent4: The planets and siders danced in the vast expanse of space.
meanings.sent5: The sider's glow added a magical touch to the dark night.

meanings.definition: A person who is present at a particular event or place.
meanings.sent1: The wedding had many well-dressed siders celebrating the couple.
meanings.sent2: The concert venue was filled with excited siders waiting for the show.
meanings.sent3: The curious siders gathered around to see what the commotion was about.
meanings.sent4: The event organizers welcomed all siders to join in the festivities.
meanings.sent5: The eager siders made the atmosphere lively and vibrant.
